definition: mountain and river exhausted (idiom); at the end of the line/nowhere to go
surname Shan
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
poor/destitute/to use up/to exhaust/thoroughly/extremely/(coll.) persistently and pointlessly
surname Shui
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to

sentences.english: Mr Green has been out of work for several months and is on his uppers.
sentences.chinese: 格林先生失业好几个月了，现在已过得山穷水尽。

sentences.english: I'm feeling really depressed about my work. I think I'm at the end of my rope.
sentences.chinese: 我真的对我的工作感到灰心，我想我山穷水尽了。

sentences.english: Richardson helped again, but Pilkington was exhausted.
sentences.chinese: 理查森又一次出手相助，但丽蒂茜娅很快又山穷水尽。

sentences.english: Most people thought Chinese cartoons had come to the end.
sentences.chinese: 大部分人都认为中国动漫业山穷水尽了。

definition: lit. the path exhausted, the end of the road (idiom); an impasse/in a plight with no way out/things have reached a dead end
to be at an impasse (idiom)/in a tight spot/at the end of one's rope/desperate
desperate straits
out of ammunition and no food left (idiom); in desperate straits
to exhaust one's limited abilities (idiom)
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
sunset, the end of the road (idiom); in terminal decline/at a dead end
lit. on all sides, the songs of Chu (idiom)/fig. surrounded by enemies, isolated and without help
if you ride a tiger, it's hard to get off (idiom); fig. impossible to stop halfway
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
circumstances
nowhere to go/at the end of one's tether
precarious as pile of eggs (idiom); ready to fall and break at any moment/in a dangerous state
end of the road/final road/fig. dead end/impasse
to stake all on one throw
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
